Comments.Message:
Woops!  I have this comment (which I've forgotten) in the function that creates the proxy object . 

    In file type.iwebsvc.fs (line 171)  
" //TODO : Add the credentials from the config items "   :-D       

~Erik

I have a workaround, however, my firewall is preventing me from checking in code.

Swap the following 
if credentialsOpt <> None then dclient.Credentials <- credentialsOpt |> Option.get

on line 108 in types.iwsloader.fs for

dclient.Credentials <- CredentialCache.DefaultNetworkCredentials;

This will set the default to send in your Windows kerb credentials when discovering the WSDL.

Hi, 

    The client credentials are determined in type.configreader.fs (lines 48-57).  By default it goes to the "else" part.
    
    let clientCredentials = 
              if config.WebServiceUseDefaultCredentials then
                 Some(CredentialCache.DefaultCredentials)
              elif  config.WebServiceUsername <> "" && config.WebServicePassword <> "" && config.WebServiceDomain <> "" then
                 let u = config.WebServiceUsername
                 let p = config.WebServicePassword
                 let d = config.WebServiceDomain
                 Some(new NetworkCredential(u,p,d) :> ICredentials )
              else  //Anonymous
                 None

       I've made Windows authentication the default.  
           (line 245 type.config.fs)     temp.WebServiceUseDefaultCredentials <- true //Default is windows authentication.
I've checked in the changes. Clientcreadentials in type.configreader.fs  should now default to Windows
